metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Some games have forces that pulls the game component in one direction, like gravity pulls objects to the ground.
content.html: Some games have forces that pulls the game component in one direction, like gravity pulls objects to the ground.

content.text: To add this functionality to our component constructor, first add a gravity property, which sets the current gravity. Then add a gravitySpeed property, which increases everytime we update the frame:
content.html: To add this functionality to our component constructor, first add a gravity property, which sets the current gravity. Then add a gravitySpeed property, which increases everytime we update the frame:

content.code_html:
function component(width, height, color, x, y, type) {
  this.type = type;
  this.width = width;
  this.height = height;
  this.x = x;
  this.y = y;
  this.speedX = 0;
  this.speedY = 0;
  this.gravity = 0.05;
  this.gravitySpeed = 0;
  this.update = function() {
    ctx = myGameArea.context;
    ctx.fillStyle = color;
    ctx.fillRect(this.x, this.y, this.width, this.height);
  }
  this.newPos = function() {
    this.gravitySpeed += this.gravity;
     this.x += this.speedX;
    this.y += this.speedY + this.gravitySpeed;
  }
}

content.text: To prevent the red square from falling forever, stop the falling when it hits the bottom of the game area:
content.html: To prevent the red square from falling forever, stop the falling when it hits the bottom of the game area:

content.code_html:
this.newPos = function() {
    this.gravitySpeed += this.gravity;
    this.x += this.speedX;
    this.y += this.speedY + this.gravitySpeed;
    this.hitBottom();
   }
  this.hitBottom = function() {
    var rockbottom = myGameArea.canvas.height - this.height;
    if (this.y > rockbottom) {
      this.y = rockbottom;
    }
  }

content.text: In a game, when you have a force that pulls you down, you should have a method to force the component to accelerate up.
content.html: In a game, when you have a force that pulls you down, you should have a method to force the component to accelerate up.

content.text: Trigger a function when someone clicks a button, and make the red square fly up in the air:
content.html: Trigger a function when someone clicks a button, and make the red square fly up in the air:

content.code_html:
<script>
function accelerate(n) {
  myGamePiece.gravity = n;
}
</script>

<button onmousedown="accelerate(-0.2)" onmouseup="accelerate(0.1)">ACCELERATE</button>

content.html: Make a game based on what we have learned so far:
